French justice stalls as evidence of police violence during 2023 protest is overlooked
description: The early November release of troubling video footage by Mediapart and 'Libération,' showing gendarmes confronting environmental activists protesting against mega-reservoirs in March 2023, has highlighted the legal system's inadequate response.

description: An advocacy group has called on France's highest administrative court to recognize that France is not doing enough to fight climate change, given its historical responsibility and financial capacity.

headline: Ivorian youth are swept up in a retro craze
description: Music and fashion from the 1960s and 1970s, once symbols of Côte d'Ivoire's post-independence economic and cultural boom, are experiencing an unexpected resurgence in popularity.

headline: Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands pull out of 2026 Eurovision over Israel's participation
description: The organizers of next year's Eurovision Song Contest announced they were allowing Israel to compete on Thursday, drawing quick announcements of withdrawals from European countries critical of the Israeli offensive in Gaza.

headline: Iran's independent cinema in full revolt: 'With Woman, Life, Freedom, a major barrier was broken'
description: Galvanized by the movement that emerged after the death of Mahsa Amini in September 2022, more and more filmmakers are dating to shoot outside any official framework. In a country where film production is a state matter, their films, made and distributed clandestinely, show Iranian society as it really is.

description: A recent study has revealed that economists have long underestimated the importance of a country's alignment with others in their analyses, reports Pauline Grosjean in her column for Le Monde.

headline: Zelensky without Yermak: The story of a split at the top of Ukraine
description: As Ukraine negotiates an end to the war, Volodymyr Zelensky had to part ways with his chief diplomat, Andriy Yermak, a political lightning rod and a close friend. The Ukrainian president is doing everything to downplay the departure of his right-hand man.

headline: Devastated Sudanese families recount el-Fasher massacre
description: Le Monde spoke with survivors of the takeover of the capital of North Darfur by paramilitary forces at the end of October. They described summary executions, rapes, large-scale human trafficking and efforts to cover up the crimes committed.
